DOC.brief_summary: It aim study compare effect 6 and/or 2 year either HIT ( carry correctly assess 85-95 % maximal heart rate ) , pyramid , continuous endurance training , change physical exercise capacity cardiac patient .
DOC.brief_title: Different Endurance Training Protocols Cardiac Patients
DOC.detailed_description: The three exercise arm ( isocaloric ) compose follow : Endurance training : 31 min 65-75 % HRmax , make total 25min ; HIT : 4x4min interval 85-95 % HRmax divide 3x3min active recovery 60-70 % HRmax , make total 25 min ; Pyramid : One pyramid consist 8 one-minute block . Those group start one block 70-75 % HRmax , follow one block 75-80 % HRmax another one 80-85 % HRmax . The top pyramid 2 block 85-90 % HRmax . Intensity lower afterwards one block 80-85 % HRmax , follow one block 75-80 % HRmax last one 70-75 % HRmax . Two pyramid follow , divide 2min active recovery 65-70 % HRmax , make total 28min . All protocol initiate 5min warm-up end 5min cool-down , 60-70 % HRmax . Primary Outcome : Individual maximum power output watt ( Pmax ) . Secondary Outcome : Change power output watt lactate tresholds 2 4mmol/l .
DOC.criteria: acute coronary syndrome ( STEMI NONSTEMI ) aortocoronary bypass surgery percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) state stable coronary heart disease state heart surgery state myo , endo , pericarditis state heart lungtransplantation state heart failure state pulmonary hypertension state peripheral venous disease state electrophysiological surgery state implantation implantable cardioverter difibrillator Patients high risk Patients cardiac dysrhythmias sudden death unstable angina pectoris Heart failure ( NYHA IV ) acute myo , endo , pericarditis infection pulmonaryarterial embolism phlebothrombosis within 6 month hemodynamic instable dysrhythmias hypertrophic cardiomyopathy medical condition prevent patient comply exercise program
